skillTree.localised_description: No traitor has ever stepped aboard Geimdall's Kingship and lived to tell the tale—its hull carries the weight of Geimdall’s unwavering honor. Legends say that the very ship itself remembers betrayal.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

ui_effects.localised_text: Spawns a unit of Marauder Champions

skillTree.localised_description: From raw meat to salted fish, the Bjornling are known to live the true carnivor way - taking all the graceful Gods offer their lands.
Geimdall's origins lay in Oseberg, the very stronghold Erik the Lost set out from on his expedition to Lustria. It is home to the finest warriors of the Bjornling tribe.

target_if: Unit is under any missile fire (gun or bow)

skillTree.localised_description: Geimdall is entrusted by the High King to lead the Bjornling Huscarl's in to battle, being the only one besides the High King having led the Bjornling tribe as a whole in to battle.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Shielded Marauder units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Can not engage in melee combat when actively commanding the shield wall

attributes.bullet_text: This unit cannot target enemy units and initiate melee attacks

skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A top an elevated rise surrounded by stockades is the King's Hall, where Ulfric and his most loyal Jarls reside. It's a pinnacle of Bjornling strength.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain: +50% for Shielded Marauder units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hornborg is a Norse Dwarf who runs an oddity shop in Skjold. Adventurers and Kings from all over travel to Skjold to barter with the stubborn dwarf, for among his trinkets are ancient artifacts of immense value.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +33% for alliances with the Empire

skillTree.localised_description: Hafskael's Yard is a shipyard located at the base of Skjold's cliff. Here, the legendary shipbuilder Hafskael and his apprenctice Lars make longboats that would instill envy in the best sailors known to men.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +10% for Norscan Longship units
	
	Note: Requires the Norscan Longship mod to be activated.

Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for all Marauder Champion and Huscarl units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Geimdall's Kingship joined the expedition led by High King Ulfric which led them to a deserted island inhabited by undead monks. Both warriors barely made it out with their lives intact.

effects.description:
Speed: +15% for Norscan Longship units
	
	Note: Requires the Norscan Longship mod to be activated.

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many of Bjornling warriors worship Odrall, who unlike in the lore of men, is known as a great wanderer and seafarer to the Norse.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Skalds
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Geimdall is argueably the strongest warrior among the Bjornling people, rivaled only by Oda Winterclaw and the High King himself. He has the loyalty of most Huscarl's, having led them in countless of raids.

effects.description:
Unit capacity: +2 for Bjornling Huscarl units
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Geimdall was not born a Norse noble, but has earned his title serving as a Huscarl. Skald's sing songs of the countless times he commanded the shield wall in battle.

effects.description: Passive Ability: "Oseberg's Champion" when on foot

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases as the unit takes damage

skillTree.localised_description: Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

skillTree.localised_description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

skillTree.localised_description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +150
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

factionEffects.localised_description: Geimdall, the right hand of High King Ulfric Grondal, is both warlord and spiritual guide to the Bjornling huscarls. His loyalty to Ulfric is unshakable, his axe ever at the king’s command. A veteran of countless raids, he dreams not of mere plunder but conquest—his eyes set upon Bretonnia, where he vows to bring low the chivalric lords and raise the Bjornling banners over their stone keeps.

effects.description: Influence the Kislevite civil war by sending Norscan Raiding parties to plunder Kislev territories
Bjornlings worship both the gods of men and Chaos, and thus can't pledge full allegiance to a Chaos god.

items.colour_text: A finely honed blade, its steel tempered by the cold northern winds and the salt of the sea. Havthrymr has split shields and skulls alike in countless battles, its edge never dulling, its name whispered in reverence by those who know the fury of the Bjornling Huscarls.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

items.colour_text: Carved from the horn of a sea-beast slain in ancient times, Bjornsmál is more than a war horn—it is the voice of the Bjornlings' fury. Its deep, mournful call rolls across the waves like a storm, stirring the blood of warriors and calling them to battle. To hear it is to know that war has come, and no man, beast, or god can silence its roar.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

items.colour_text: No traitor has ever stepped aboard Geimdall's Kingship and lived to tell the tale—its hull carries the weight of Geimdall’s unwavering honor. Legends say that the ship itself remembers betrayal, the timbers creaking with whispers of broken vows. Those who break their oaths to the High Jarl find no refuge upon its deck, for the sea itself conspires against them—storms rise without warning, ropes snap like strangling hands, and the water drags them down, never to be seen again. Only those whose word is iron may sail beneath its banners, for treachery finds no quarter on the Oathbreaker’s Bane.

effects.description: Replenishes 25% campaign movement range after winning a battle

Melee defence: +8 for Shielded Marauder units
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: As the High Jarl, Geimdall is a loyal warmonger found always at King Ulfric's side - having joined him on countless raids and expeditions.

effects.description:
Ability: "Geimdall's Shield Wall" for Shielded Marauder units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for each confederated Norscan tribe
	(all units in army)
